definition: to jump/to leap
tender/gentle/to die prematurely
variant of 夭[yao1]/to die young/to die prematurely/Taiwan pr. [yao3]
active/lively/excited/to enliven/to brighten up
to leap/to jump/eager/enthusiastically
to leap
to jump/to leap/to bound/to skip
to vault
to be eager to give sth a try (idiom)
to be eager to give sth a try (idiom)
excited/in high spirits
to leap forward/to make rapid progress/a leap forward
Great Leap Forward (1958-1960), Mao's attempt to modernize China's economy, which resulted in economic devastation, and millions of deaths from famine caused by misguided policies
to show forth/to appear as a vivid image/to stand out markedly
to appear vividly on paper (idiom); to show forth vividly (in writing, painting etc)/to stand out markedly
duplex (apartment)
to gallop/to spur on a horse/to let one's steed have his head
lit. dragon soaring and tiger leaping (idiom)/fig. prosperous and bustling/vigorous and active

sentences.english: A large body of evidence has demonstrated that ethylene is the hormone of catalyzing fruit ripening.
sentences.chinese: 大量研究证实，乙烯是跃变型成熟果实的催熟剂。

sentences.english: As an undergraduate, Chi Wa was an extremely active junior research assistant.
sentences.chinese: 他当本科生时，是个非常跃的初级助研。

sentences.english: The jump-change stage of carbohydrate content was consistent with the process of en-dodorman cy.
sentences.chinese: 碳水化合物含量的跃变期与自然休眠的进程相吻合。

sentences.english: Also, a climbing move in which the climber lunges or leaps to the next hold.
sentences.chinese: 也指攀登者跃向下一个支点的动作。

sentences.english: Wenfengta leaps Mt. Longshan located at Ninghai County, was constructs at the end of the Ming dynasty brick tower.
sentences.chinese: 文峰塔位于宁海县跃龙山，是建于明末的砖塔。

sentences.english: It gathers much speed , leaps or jumps right out of the water.
sentences.chinese: 它积聚了大量的速度，跳跃着跃水而出。

sentences.english: And the young Fisherman leapt up, and left his wattled house, and ran down to the shore.
sentences.chinese: 年轻的渔夫跃然而起，冲出了他的小屋，奔向海岸。

sentences.english: The fish plopped back into the river.
sentences.chinese: 那鱼扑通一声跃回河中。

sentences.english: Eventhough I want to have something changed, I will never supass those tedious words.
sentences.chinese: 为什么永远也跃不过那些枯燥的言语。

sentences.english: As soon as the price picks up enquiries will revive.
sentences.chinese: 一旦价钱上升，询盘将恢新生跃。

sentences.english: They each grabbed one of my elbows and half-carried me as they flew down the stairs.
sentences.chinese: 她们一人抓住我一只胳膊，半提着我跃下了楼梯。

sentences.english: But did you know great white sharks can breach as well?
sentences.chinese: 但你知道大白鲨也能鲸跃吗？

sentences.english: When he tried to ride the horse, it bucked wildly.
sentences.chinese: 当他试图骑上这匹马时，它突然狂暴地跃了起来。

sentences.english: Create a circle while hopping on one foot.
sentences.chinese: 游戏要求玩家单脚跳跃，同时，组成一个圈。

definition: to leap/to spring/to throw oneself
be high up in the sky
to move quickly/to vault/flying tackle
to jump up suddenly/to bound up/to rise up in one bound
to leap up/(coll.) to gush out/to spurt out
to soar/to rise high into the air
to flee/to scuttle/to exile or banish/to amend or edit
to take a (striding) step
to stride/to bound
to take over by force/to rob/to plunder/to brush over/to skim/to sweep
to throw oneself at/to pounce on/to devote one's energies/to flap/to flutter/to dab/to pat/to bend over
to dodge
to charge/to pounce on/to swoop down on
to hop/to jump
to jump/to bounce/to hop
to promote (to official position in former times)
